enWisdom: A noble-minded person is one who initiates his act of kindness [before it is requested of him]
The munificent person is one who bestows his favours generously [to others]
The munificent person is one whose giving precedes his being asked
The success of noble-minded people is [through] forgiveness and benevolence
The shadow of noble-minded people is vast and pleasant
Doing good to others is the habit of noble-minded people
The symbol of nobility is doing good to people

Wisdom: لِكُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ فَضِيلَةٌ وَفَضِيلَةُ الْكِرَامِ اصْطِنَاعُ الرِّجَالِ
enWisdom: Everything has a merit and the merit of the honourable ones is doing good to the people

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَتْ عَوَارِفُهُ أَبَانَ عَنْ كَثْرَةِ نُبْلِهِ
enWisdom: One whose benefactions are abundant demonstrates his great nobility

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُجَازِ الْإِسَاءَةَ بِالْإِحْسَانِ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ الْكِرَامِ
enWisdom: One who does not recompense offence with favour is not from the noble-minded ones

Wisdom: مِنَ الْكَرَمِ [الكريم‏] اصْطِنَاعُ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَبَذْلُ الرِّفْدِ
enWisdom: Part of nobleness is doing good to others and granting [them] support

Wisdom: نِظَامُ الْكَرَمِ مُوَالاةُ الْإِحْسَانِ وَمُوَاسَاةُ الْإِخْوَانِ
enWisdom: The order of nobleness entails successively doing good to others and assisting one’s brothers [financially]
